text: But I actually think it's a much richer space and it contains other very high agency patterns that we recognize as kinds of minds. And everything, everything that we do are, is, is basically poking holes in this, in this kind of separation between the interfaces and the patterns that that ingress through, through these, through these interfaces. And so, and so it's just the very last thing I'll say is lest we get too smug about our ability to access this space because you know, among us are certain geniuses that can perceive incredible, incredible truths and works of art and literature and so on. And so they're picking out, right, they're picking out things out of that space and letting them come into the, come into the world. Lest we think that this is some kind capability, I will just point out that first of all, there are no humans as a sharp category.
content_summary: The speaker discusses the concept of cognitive patterns and how humans interact with reality through interfaces. They highlight the exceptional abilities of certain individuals to perceive and bring forth unique truths, art, and literature from this cognitive space. The speaker also questions the clear categorization of humans.
